description: I gave all available permissions and it will not launch.
run as su in terminal .. use options as depicted

JJust a little more instructions on how to set parameters for a noob like myself. I entered the same command shown in the description and then I did the math, which came out to a 24hr stress test! How do you do a 10 minute test?
Ran stress test on all 16 threads of my CPU and it brought CPU usage to 100%... Used the example command in --help and changed cpu to 16 and fork to 16

Come on, people! It's a terminal application! Hit ctrl-alt-T to bring up the terminal. Then type::~$ stress-ng --cpu 0 --metrics-brief --perf --timeout 120 --tz
stress-ng: info: [4015] dispatching hogs: 4 cpu
stress-ng: info: [4015] successful run completed in 120.27s (2 mins, 0.27 secs)
stress-ng: info: [4015] stressor    bogo ops real time usr time sys time  bogo ops/s  bogo ops/s
stress-ng: info: [4015]              (secs)  (secs)  (secs)  (real time) (usr+sys time)
stress-ng: info: [4015] cpu        38672  120.12  378.53   0.53    321.94    102.02
stress-ng: info: [4015] thermal zone temperatures not available
ljp@LJP-HP-ENVY-dv7:~$
summary: Load in Terminal. Not a GUI!

description: Has a wide range of stress tests and covers a lot of the kernel interfaces.
summary: A useful command line tool for exercising and stress testing

description:
Works great. 12 CPU cores at 100%.
Just use the console
IF is not a GUI Program. Please, provide here on the store some main command how to use it at least. thanks.
checked on my macbook pro, works fine

Erase review I been hacking at, cause I tried to open a 2nd window to call Larry by name. -- was another. why 2 dashes? And why no std help at all? Ya, lots use --help, but not all, and 95+% of options need 2 dashes?
Eli: the flash of the terminal is the hint the author did neither test the launch, nor a non-interactive shell print "command line only" and pause. (or as noted, write it here) 
Larry - tried to open a 2nd bunt Software because I can't scroll the window under a dialog (why is that? that's just wrong) but it just deletes the old window/dialog/comment and gives a new one. I tried your ex. with 25 sec. or so, and both --cpu 0 and --cpu 12 with same results, meaning 0 prob. means all. *Then* it said:
stress-ng: info: [4904] thermal zone temperatures not available... which finally pushed it down to 4 star.
an ya. been using Linux since about v0.98 so lots of repetitive of the annoyances. try and go fix one, find 10 more and end up spending 3 weeks due to sloppy coding and random standardization. And supposed to have pics now, but where to put em? I'd have half the missing ones done over the last 4 months. (sorry, babble..)
